As the couple exited the theater just before 10 p.m., Kayln Freire was surrounded by about 15 girls who appeared like they were going to attack her, Federico Freire said.
 
 A witness told Freire that he had a firearm in his vehicle and offered to escort the couple to safety.
 
 Federico Freire said he told his wife to go with the witness to get her out of harm's way.
 
 Seven males then surrounded Federico Freire and began to kick and punch him, according to the sheriff's office report; he was struck across the left side of his face.
 
 "I got back up to defend myself and they started running everywhere," he said.
 
 A crowd of about 100 people began to form.
 
 When Freire looked to his wife, he said he saw a young male with his shirt off punch her in the face, knocking her out.
 
 Freire said he went after the youth and the witness brandished his gun, telling the crowd to step back.
 
 Deputies arrived shortly thereafter.
 
 White Couple Attacked By Dozens of Black “Youths” in Bradenton, Florida, Media Silent : Conservative Nation

post_info.post_title: Another Example of how Defensive Gun use is a myth....

Thats cherry-picking!

 
 A one sentence reply is the best you can do to address this issue of a gang violence survivor protecting himself and coming out alive and ahead of the situation? You're really starting to slip in terms of quality Brady, if that's at all possible.
 
 You claim that Nozza's post is an example of cherry picking. Yet you offer no examples of just how this qualifies as cherry picking. You just blurt it out and expect us to take your word for it. You failed to elaborate on just how reporting an incident of gang violence amounts to this. Cherry picking is the practice of taking a selected example that fits one's personal position the best, and putting it forward in a manner to try and suggest that it's the norm and the status quo of everyday events.
 
 With this fact in mind, one could easily suggest that a lot of what you post and point to amounts to cherry picking practices.
